questions.full_question_text: You receive an IFR enroute clearance stating: Clearance expires at 0920. What does it mean?
options: The take off clearance is expected at 0920
If not airborne until 0920, a new clearance has to be issued
After 0920 return to the ramp and file a new flight plan
questions.solution: If not airborne until 0920, a new clearance has to be issued

questions.full_question_text: If radio communication failure is experienced on an IFR flight in IMC, generally the pilot shall:
options: Land on the nearest suitable aerodrome and report the termination of the flight to ATC.
Try to get contact on other frequencies either ground or aircraft stations - Transmit being indicating important details required 2 times.
Try to get contact on other frequencies either ground or aircraft stations.
Transmit blind indicating details required at least 2 times.
questions.solution: Try to get contact on other frequencies either ground or aircraft stations - Transmit being indicating important details required 2 times.

questions.full_question_text: Who is responsible for an ATC clearance to be safe in respect to terrain clearance?
options: The air traffic service reporting office when accepting the flight plan

questions.full_question_text: Independent parallel approaches may be conducted to parallel runways provided that a no transgression zone (NTZ) of at least:
options: 500 m is established between extended runway centre lines and as is depicted on the radar display
710 m is established between extended runway centre lines and as is depicted on the radar display
600 m is established between extended runway centre lines and as is depicted on the radar display
610 m is established between extended runway centre lines and as is depicted on the radar display
questions.solution: 610 m is established between extended runway centre lines and as is depicted on the radar display

questions.full_question_text: Aerodromes signs should be in the following configuration:
options: mandatory instruction signs, red background with black inscriptions.
information signs, orange background with black inscriptions.
information signs, yellow or black background with black or yellow inscriptions
mandatory instruction signs, black background with red inscriptions.
questions.solution: information signs, yellow or black background with black or yellow inscriptions

questions.full_question_text: VFR flights shall not be flown over the congested areas of cities at a height less than
options: 2000 ft above the highest obstacle within a radius of 600 ft from the aircraft
1000 ft above the highest obstacle within a radius of 600 m from the aircraft.
questions.solution: 1000 ft above the highest obstacle within a radius of 600 m from the aircraft.

caused by an increase in the partial pressure of oxygen associated with a decrease in altitude
due to pressure differentials between gases in hollow cavities of the body and the ambient pressure
mainly associated with a sink rate which exceeds the ability of the body to balance its internal pressures
questions.solution: due to pressure differentials between gases in hollow cavities of the body and the ambient pressure

questions.full_question_text: An aircraft encountering radio communication failure on an IFR flight in VMC is assumed to:
options: Continue the flight to destination aerodrome in any case
Squawk IDENT and proceed to the alternate aerodrome
Continue to fly in VMC, land at the nearest suitable aerodrome, report its arrival
Leave controlled airspace and continue the flight within uncontrolled airspace
questions.solution: Continue to fly in VMC, land at the nearest suitable aerodrome, report its arrival

You should maintain that airway by use of your navigation equipment
questions.solution: You should maintain that airway by use of your navigation equipment

questions.full_question_text: During an IFR flight in VMC inside controlled airspace, if a two-way radio failure occurs, what action should the pilot take?
options: Land at the nearest suitable aerodrome maintaining VMC and inform ATC
Select A7600 and continue as per current flight plan to destination
Land at the nearest aerodrome and inform ATC
questions.solution: Land at the nearest suitable aerodrome maintaining VMC and inform ATC

questions.full_question_text: The signal from the pilot to the marshaller indicating that brakes are applied is:
options: Clenching the fist in front of the face and then extending the fingers
Crossing both hands in front of the face with palms facing outward, then moving the arms apart
Raising one arm with fingers extended in front of the face and then closing the hand into a fist
Extending both arms downward and rotating wrists outward
questions.solution: Raising one arm with fingers extended in front of the face and then closing the hand into a fist

questions.full_question_text: Runway threshold identification lights, when provided, should be:

Fixed unidirectional lights showing green in the direction of approach to the runway
questions.solution: Fixed unidirectional lights showing green in the direction of approach to the runway

questions.solution: Both A and B are correct.
